laboratory_examinations.findings: Severe mitral stenosis; mitral valve area 0.6 cmÂ²; peak/mean transmitral pressure gradient 47/27 mmHg; severe resting pulmonary hypertension (tricuspid regurgitant jet velocity 3.9 m/s; peak pressure gradient 63 mmHg); left atrium dimension 35 mm.
Abundant granules in foamy macrophages and interstitial spaces that were positive for periodic acid-Schiff stain and diastase sensitive.
Deficient activity of iduronate-2-sulfatase confirming diagnosis of type II MPS (Hunter's syndrome).
